def_en: Pyramids are ancient stone buildings with four triangular sloping sides. The most famous pyramids are those built in ancient Egypt to contain the bodies of their kings and queens.
A pyramid is a shape, object, or pile of things with a flat base and sloping triangular sides that meet at a point.

def_cn: 金字塔式结构（或组织、体系）
def_en: You can describe something as a pyramid when it is organized so that there are fewer people at each level as you go towards the top.
